pal 0.0.9101

Sort vector by another vector

Source: R/pal.gen.R
sort_by.Rd

Orders a vector x by the order of another vector by.

Usage

sort_by(x, by)

Arguments

x

Vector to be ordered.

by

Reference vector which x will be ordered by.

Value

A permutation of x.

Examples

library(magrittr)

# generate 100 random letters
random_letters <-
  letters %>%
  magrittr::extract(sample.int(n = 26L,
                               size = 100L,
                               replace = TRUE)) %T>%
  print()
#>   [1] "w" "k" "d" "l" "n" "s" "y" "g" "v" "z" "i" "g" "b" "p" "m" "s" "x" "t" "o" "g" "d" "a" "h" "t" "y" "p" "x" "v" "k" "p" "t" "h" "c" "d" "t" "l" "v" "q"
#>  [39] "j" "t" "k" "y" "w" "h" "n" "u" "m" "b" "k" "m" "n" "f" "y" "h" "l" "z" "d" "m" "n" "u" "p" "w" "a" "h" "h" "j" "y" "h" "r" "u" "i" "g" "g" "z" "j" "x"
#>  [77] "v" "w" "z" "k" "a" "y" "s" "j" "u" "v" "m" "k" "k" "y" "t" "z" "g" "y" "w" "z" "t" "x" "y" "i"

# sort the random letters alphabetically
random_letters %>% pal::sort_by(by = letters)
#>   [1] "a" "a" "a" "b" "b" "c" "d" "d" "d" "d" "f" "g" "g" "g" "g" "g" "g" "h" "h" "h" "h" "h" "h" "h" "i" "i" "i" "j" "j" "j" "j" "k" "k" "k" "k" "k" "k" "k"
#>  [39] "l" "l" "l" "m" "m" "m" "m" "m" "n" "n" "n" "n" "o" "p" "p" "p" "p" "q" "r" "s" "s" "s" "t" "t" "t" "t" "t" "t" "t" "u" "u" "u" "u" "v" "v" "v" "v" "v"
#>  [77] "w" "w" "w" "w" "w" "x" "x" "x" "x" "y" "y" "y" "y" "y" "y" "y" "y" "y" "z" "z" "z" "z" "z" "z"
